items.catalyzed_reaction: NADP(H)-dependent oxidation of alcohols and reduction of aldehydes/ketones.
items.formulation: All purification steps performed in TEA–HCl buffer (50 mmol L-1, pH 7.5), supplemented with CaCl2 (0–0.8 mmol L-1) as needed. Storage tested in desalting buffer (TEA–HCl, 10 mmol L-1, pH 7.5) at 8°C or -20°C, or in 50% (v/v) glycerol/desalting buffer at -20°C, or as freeze-dried enzyme at -20°C.
items.name: RADH (alcohol dehydrogenase from Ralstonia sp.)
items.purification_method: Three protocols, using TEA–HCl buffer (50 mmol/L, pH 7.5), with or without 0.2–0.8 mmol/L CaCl2. Protocol includes size exclusion chromatography (SEC) for desalting, anion exchange chromatography, and a second SEC for removal of NaCl and adjustment of Ca2+ concentration.
items.purity_specification: Estimated by SDS–PAGE (Laemmli, 1970), stained with SimplyBlue SafeStain or SilverXpress Silver Staining Kit.
items.special_treatment: SDS–PAGE performed on 4–12% NuPAGE Novex Bis–Tris gels. Protein concentrations determined by Bradford assay (Bradford, 1976) with bovine serum albumin standard. Molecular weight estimation via SEC (Superdex 200, 26 mm x 63 cm, GE Healthcare), calibrated with protein standards. Purified and desalted enzyme stored in TEA–HCl buffer (10 mmol/L, pH 7.5) at 8°C, -20°C, with 50% glycerol at -20°C, or freeze-dried at -20°C.
